software.leonov.util.gson

Class GsonHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.util.gson.GsonHelper

  • public final class GsonHelper
extends Object
    A collection of static utility methods that simplify common serialization and deserialization operations using Google Gson.

    At the core of GsonHelper is a default Gson instance (suitable for general use cases) which supports Java 8+ java.time classes, Optionals, Guava's Multiset, Multimap, and Table collection types, serializes nulls, does not escape HTML characters, and outputs pretty printed JSON text.

    If you would like to use your own Gson instance you can register adapters for Guava's collection types along with gson-javatime-serialisers manually.

    For example: 

    
   private static final Gson GSON = GsonHelper.registerAll(Converters.registerAll(new GsonBuilder())
           .serializeNulls()
           .setPrettyPrinting()
           .disableHtmlEscaping())
           .enableComplexMapKeySerialization()
           .create();
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

      • nextNull

        public static Void nextNull(JsonReader in)
                     throws IOException
        Consumes and returns the next JsonToken and asserts that it is a literal null.

        This method behaves identically to the void method JsonReader.nextNull() but returns a null reference to allow for more streamlined code when assigning the null value in a one-liner.

        Parameters:
        in - the JsonReader to read from
        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • parseJson

        public static JsonElement parseJson(JsonReader in)
        Consumes and returns the next JsonElement parsed from the specified JsonReader. The element is either a JsonObject, a JsonArray, a JsonPrimitive or a JsonNull.

        This method is identical to nextElement(JsonReader).

        Parameters:
        in - the JsonReader to read from
        Returns:
        returns the next JsonElement parsed from the specified JsonReader

      • parseJson

        public static JsonElement parseJson(InputStream in)
                             throws IOException
        Parses JSON content from an InputStream using the UTF-8 charset.

        Note: Buffering the input stream is superfluous.

        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from
        Returns:
        a tree of JsonElements parsed from the specified InputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • prettify

        public static String prettify(String text)
        Returns pretty printed JSON text from the original unformatted string.

        The JSON string must be valid according to RFC 4627.

        Parameters:
        text - the JSON String to format
        Returns:
        pretty printed JSON text from the original unformatted string
